N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1502.3 - Watchman's clock

State Regulations
(a) For new
watchman's clock systems, the watchman's portable mechanically driven clock
shall be capable of running at least 48 hours without rewinding, shall contain
a mechanism which is manually operated by recording keys fixed at call
stations, and shall record legibly and permanently on a chart or tape each
station number and time of recording. (b) Watchman's clocks shall be substantially
mounted and strongly encased. (c) New and existing watchman's clocks shall be enclosed so that access thereto
cannot be had without automatically recording the time of opening and
closing. Notes
